--- title: GDP per Cap in different continents author: Prince date: 9-Jul-25 warning: false #######image: tb.png format: html: code-fold: true code-summary: "Show code" code-tools: true --- ## Loading the datasets and packages We will first load the essential **packages** and **dataset** ::: {#bf576ba3 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code code-summary="Set up code"} #Import data import pandas as pd df = pd.read_csv("../../data_sources/gapminder.csv") ``` ::: ## Inspect data ::: {#af723183 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns df.info() df.describe() df.dtypes df["lifeExp"] df["lifeExp"].unique() df["lifeExp"].describe() df["continent"].describe() df["continent"] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` RangeIndex: 1704 entries, 0 to 1703 Data columns (total 6 columns): # Column Non-Null Count Dtype --- ------ -------------- ----- 0 country 1704 non-null object 1 year 1704 non-null int64 2 pop 1704 non-null float64 3 continent 1704 non-null object 4 lifeExp 1704 non-null float64 5 gdpPercap 1704 non-null float64 dtypes: float64(3), int64(1), object(2) memory usage: 80.0+ KB ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ``` 0 Asia 1 Asia 2 Asia 3 Asia 4 Asia ... 1699 Africa 1700 Africa 1701 Africa 1702 Africa 1703 Africa Name: continent, Length: 1704, dtype: object ``` ::: ::: ## Filter and subset the data and grouping ::: {#225859ee .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} subset_con=df[["continent", "gdpPercap", "year"]] summary_con= subset_con.groupby("continent")["gdpPercap"].mean() summary_con= summary_con.reset_index() ``` ::: ## Visualize the data Summary of mean GDP per Cap in different continents ::: {#00430446 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} import seaborn as sns sns.catplot(data=df, x="continent", y="gdpPercap", kind="box", estimator="std", hue="continent" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![GPD per Capital in different continents](gapminder2025_files/figure-html/cell-5-output-1.png){width=470 height=470} ::: ::: ## Visualize the data Summary of GDP per Cap in different continents ::: {#f33245b2 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} sns.catplot(data=summary_con, x="continent", y="gdpPercap", kind="box", estimator="std", hue="continent" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](gapminder2025_files/figure-html/cell-6-output-1.png){width=470 height=470} ::: ::: ## Interactive plot ::: {#720d54e3 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} import plotly.express as px import matplotlib.pyplot as plt px.scatter(data_frame = df, x = "continent", y = "gdpPercap", color = "continent") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Make a global chloropeth We will now visualize it on a world map ::: {#dd25200a .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Compute mean GDP per capita per continent continent_gdp = df.groupby("continent")["gdpPercap"].mean() # Map each country's continent GDP df["continent_gdp"] = df["continent"].map(continent_gdp) # Drop duplicates to keep only one row per country country_continent_gdp = df.drop_duplicates("country")[["country", "continent_gdp"]] #plot px.choropleth(country_continent_gdp, locations="country", locationmode="country names", color="continent_gdp", color_continuous_scale="Plasma", title="Continent-Level Avg GDP per Capita (Mapped by Country)", labels={"continent_gdp": "Continent Avg GDP"}) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` GPD per Capital in different continents ::: :::
